programName: Program to Check if a String contains only digits?
code: // Program to Check if a String contains only digits? public class CheckDigitsExample { public static void main(String[] args) { // Test Strings String str1 = "12345"; String str2 = "abc123"; String str3 = "6789xyz"; String str4 = ""; // Check if Strings contain only digits checkDigits(str1); checkDigits(str2); checkDigits(str3); checkDigits(str4); } // Helper method to check if a String contains only digits private static void checkDigits(String str) { if (str.matches("\d+")) { System.out.println("'" + str + "' contains only digits."); } else { System.out.println("'" + str + "' does not contain only digits."); } } }
output:
'12345' contains only digits.
        'abc123' does not contain only digits.
        '6789xyz' does not contain only digits.
        '' does not contain only digits.

programName: Program to perform Deep Copy for String?
code: // Program to perform Deep Copy for String? public class DeepCopyStringExample { public static void main(String[] args) { // Original string String originalString = "Hello, World!"; // Perform deep copy using the String constructor String deepCopyString1 = new String(originalString); // Perform deep copy using the substring method String deepCopyString2 = originalString.substring(0); // Display original and deep copy strings System.out.println("Original String: " + originalString); System.out.println("Deep Copy String 1: " + deepCopyString1); System.out.println("Deep Copy String 2: " + deepCopyString2); } }
output:
Original String: Hello, World!
        Deep Copy String 1: Hello, World!
        Deep Copy String 2: Hello, World!

programName: Program to prove String is immutable programmatically?
code: // Program to prove String is immutable programmatically? public class ImmutableStringExample { public static void main(String[] args) { // Original string String originalString = "Hello, World!"; // Modify the original string String modifiedString = modifyString(originalString); // Display original and modified strings System.out.println("Original String: " + originalString); System.out.println("Modified String: " + modifiedString); } // Helper method to modify a string private static String modifyString(String str) { // Strings are immutable, so any modification results in a new string str = str.concat(" Welcome!"); return str; } }
output:
Original String: Hello, World!
        Modified String: Hello, World! Welcome!

programName: Program to remove all occurrences of a given character from input String?
code: // Program to remove all occurrences of a given character from input String? import java.util.Scanner; public class RemoveCharacterExample { public static void main(String[] args) { // Input string Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in); System.out.print("Enter a string: "); String inputString = scanner.nextLine(); // Input character to remove System.out.print("Enter the character to remove: "); char charToRemove = scanner.next().charAt(0); // Remove occurrences of the specified character String resultString = removeCharacter(inputString, charToRemove); // Display the result System.out.println("Original String: " + inputString); System.out.println("String after removing '" + charToRemove + "': " + resultString); } // Helper method to remove occurrences of a character from a string private static String removeCharacter(String str, char charToRemove) { // Use StringBuilder for efficient string manipulation StringBuilder result = new StringBuilder(); // Iterate through each character in the original string for (char c : str.toCharArray()) { // Append the character to the result if it is not the one to be removed if (c != charToRemove) { result.append(c); } } // Convert StringBuilder to String return result.toString(); } }
output:
Enter a string: programming
        Enter the character to remove: r
        Original String: programming
        String after removing 'r': pogamming

programName: Program to append the string using StringBuffer class
code: // Program to append the string using StringBuffer class public class StringBufferExample { public static void main(String[] args) { // Create a StringBuffer StringBuffer stringBuffer = new StringBuffer("Hello, "); // Append strings stringBuffer.append("Java ").append("Programming").append("!"); // Display the result System.out.println("Appended String: " + stringBuffer.toString()); } }

programName: Program to insert the string using StringBuffer class
code: // Program to insert the string using StringBuffer class public class StringBufferInsertExample { public static void main(String[] args) { // Original string StringBuffer originalBuffer = new StringBuffer("Hello, Programming!"); // String to insert String toInsert = "Java "; // Index at which to insert the string int insertIndex = 7; // Insert the string originalBuffer.insert(insertIndex, toInsert); // Display the result System.out.println("Original String: " + originalBuffer.toString()); } }
